title: Data Privacy Laws Basics üìú
ques: Name **three major data privacy regulations** and the region each applies to.

answer.content:
### Major Data Privacy Regulations:

| Regulation | Region | Key Focus |
|------------|--------|----------|
| **GDPR** | European Union | Consent, data rights, 72-hour breach notification |
| **CCPA** | California, USA | Consumer rights, opt-out of data sale |
| **LGPD** | Brazil | Similar to GDPR, explicit consent required |

### Additional Regulations:
- **HIPAA** (USA) - Healthcare data
- **POPIA** (South Africa) - Personal information protection

explanation: Data scientists must understand **regulatory requirements** that govern data usage in different regions.

title: Ethical Data Collection ü§ù
ques: List **four principles** of ethical data collection that every data scientist should follow.

answer.content:
### Four Ethical Data Collection Principles:

| Principle | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| **Informed Consent** | Users know what data is collected and why |
| **Purpose Limitation** | Data used only for stated purposes |
| **Data Minimization** | Collect only what's necessary |
| **Transparency** | Clear privacy policies, accessible to users |

### Checklist:
- [ ] Clear consent mechanism
- [ ] Purpose clearly stated
- [ ] Minimal data collected
- [ ] Privacy policy available

explanation: **Ethical collection** builds trust and ensures compliance with regulations.

title: Identifying Bias in Data üîç
ques: Describe **three types of bias** that can occur in machine learning datasets.

answer.content:
### Three Types of ML Bias:

| Bias Type | Description | Example |
|-----------|-------------|--------|
| **Selection Bias** | Sample doesn't represent population | Hiring model trained only on past hires |
| **Measurement Bias** | Inconsistent data collection | Different criteria for different groups |
| **Historical Bias** | Past discrimination in data | Credit scoring reflecting past discrimination |

### Impact:
- Unfair predictions for certain groups
- Legal and reputational risks
- Reinforces societal inequalities

explanation: **Bias awareness** is crucial for building fair and equitable AI systems.

title: AI Transparency Requirements üí°
ques: What is **model explainability** and why is it important in AI ethics?

answer.content:
### Model Explainability:

**Definition:** The ability to understand and explain how an AI model makes decisions.

### Why It Matters:

| Reason | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| **Trust** | Users can understand and trust decisions |
| **Debugging** | Find and fix model errors |
| **Compliance** | Meet regulatory requirements (GDPR right to explanation) |
| **Fairness** | Detect discriminatory patterns |

### Tools:
- **LIME** - Local Interpretable Model Explanations
- **SHAP** - SHapley Additive exPlanations

explanation: **Explainability** enables stakeholders to understand AI decisions, crucial for high-stakes applications.

title: Accountability Framework ‚öñÔ∏è
ques: Create a simple **accountability checklist** for deploying an AI model in production.

answer.content:
### AI Deployment Accountability Checklist:

#### Pre-Deployment:
- [ ] Bias testing completed on diverse groups
- [ ] Model documentation complete
- [ ] Stakeholder review and sign-off
- [ ] Explainability mechanisms in place

#### Post-Deployment:
- [ ] Monitoring for drift and fairness
- [ ] Clear escalation path for issues
- [ ] Human override capability exists
- [ ] Regular audit schedule defined

#### Ownership:
| Role | Responsibility |
|------|---------------|
| Data Scientist | Model accuracy, documentation |
| Legal | Compliance verification |
| Ethics Board | Fairness review |

explanation: **Accountability** ensures someone is responsible for AI outcomes and issues are addressed.

title: Privacy-Preserving Techniques üîê
ques: Name **two techniques** for protecting privacy in data science projects.

answer.content:
### Privacy-Preserving Techniques:

| Technique | Description | Use Case |
|-----------|-------------|----------|
| **Data Anonymization** | Remove personally identifiable information | Publishing datasets |
| **Differential Privacy** | Add noise to prevent individual identification | Aggregate statistics |

### Additional Methods:
- **Data Masking** - Hide sensitive fields
- **Encryption** - Secure data at rest and in transit
- **Federated Learning** - Train on decentralized data

explanation: **Privacy techniques** enable data usage while protecting individuals.

title: Ethical AI Case Study üìã
ques: A company wants to use facial recognition for employee attendance. List **two ethical concerns** and **one mitigation** for each.

answer.content:
### Facial Recognition Ethics:

| Concern | Description | Mitigation |
|---------|-------------|------------|
| **Privacy** | Biometric data is sensitive | Implement strict access controls, clear consent |
| **Bias** | Different accuracy across demographics | Test across diverse groups, provide alternatives |

### Additional Considerations:
- Employee opt-out options
- Data retention policies
- Third-party data sharing restrictions

explanation: **Ethical evaluation** should precede any biometric system deployment.

title: GDPR Rights for Individuals üá™üá∫
ques: List **four rights** that GDPR grants to individuals regarding their personal data.

answer.content:
### GDPR Individual Rights:

| Right | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| **Right to Access** | Request copies of personal data |
| **Right to Erasure** | "Right to be forgotten" |
| **Right to Rectification** | Correct inaccurate data |
| **Right to Portability** | Receive data in usable format |

### Additional Rights:
- Right to restrict processing
- Right to object to processing
- Rights related to automated decision-making

explanation: Understanding **data subject rights** is essential for GDPR compliance.
